## Time Value of Money

### Future Value

You can save $5,000 per year for the next 5 years in an account earning 8 percent per year. How much will you have at the end of the fourth year if you make the first deposit today?

```{r FutureValue}

FV <- ((((((5000 * 1.08) + 5000) * 1.08) + 5000 * 1.08) + 5000 * 1.08) + 5000 * 1.08)

FV
```


### Yield to Maturity

A US Treasury bond today trades at $101.1, for a $100 face value payable in two years.  The coupon rate is 3% payable semi-annual.  What is the yield to maturity?

```{r YTM, echo=TRUE}
library(FinancialMath)
face       <- 100
price      <- 101.1
rateCoupon <- 3/100/2
cashCoupon <- face*rateCoupon
cf         <- c(cashCoupon, cashCoupon, cashCoupon, cashCoupon + face)
ts         <- c(1/2,1,1.5,2)
ts         <- c(1,2,3,4)

ytm        <- (IRR(cf0 = -price, cf = cf, times = ts)) * 100 * 2
ytm
```
